verses.verse: Man <WH120> that is born <WH3205> of a woman <WH802> is of few <WH7116> days <WH3117>, and full <WH7649> of trouble <WH7267>. few: Heb. short of days
He cometh forth <WH3318> like a flower <WH6731>, and is cut down <WH5243>: he fleeth <WH1272> also as a shadow <WH6738>, and continueth <WH5975> not.
And dost thou open <WH6491> thine eyes <WH5869> upon such an one <WH2088>, and bringest <WH935> me into judgment <WH4941> with thee?
Who can bring <WH5414> a clean <WH2889> thing out of an unclean <WH2931>? not one <WH259>. can: Heb. will give
Seeing <WH518> his days <WH3117> are determined <WH2782>, the number <WH4557> of his months <WH2320> are with thee, thou hast appointed <WH6213> his bounds <WH2706> that he cannot pass <WH5674>;
Turn <WH8159> from him, that he may rest <WH2308>, till he shall accomplish <WH7521>, as an hireling <WH7916>, his day <WH3117>. rest: Heb. cease
For there is <WH3426> hope <WH8615> of a tree <WH6086>, if it be cut down <WH3772>, that it will sprout again <WH2498>, and that the tender branch <WH3127> thereof will not cease <WH2308>.
Though the root <WH8328> thereof wax old <WH2204> in the earth <WH776>, and the stock <WH1503> thereof die <WH4191> in the ground <WH6083>;
Yet through the scent <WH7381> of water <WH4325> it will bud <WH6524>, and bring forth <WH6213> boughs <WH7105> like a plant <WH5194>.
But man <WH1397> dieth <WH4191>, and wasteth away <WH2522>: yea, man <WH120> giveth up the ghost <WH1478>, and where is he? wasteth: Heb. is weakened, or, cut off
As the waters <WH4325> fail <WH235> from the sea <WH3220>, and the flood <WH5104> decayeth <WH2717> and drieth up <WH3001>:
So man <WH376> lieth down <WH7901>, and riseth <WH6965> not: till the heavens <WH8064> be no more <WH1115>, they shall not awake <WH6974>, nor be raised out <WH5782> of their sleep <WH8142>.

O that <WH5414> thou wouldest hide <WH6845> me in the grave <WH7585>, that thou wouldest keep me secret <WH5641>, until thy wrath <WH639> be past <WH7725>, that thou wouldest appoint <WH7896> me a set time <WH2706>, and remember <WH2142> me!
If a man <WH1397> die <WH4191>, shall he live <WH2421> again? all the days <WH3117> of my appointed time <WH6635> will I wait <WH3176>, till my change <WH2487> come <WH935>.
Thou shalt call <WH7121>, and I will answer <WH6030> thee: thou wilt have a desire <WH3700> to the work <WH4639> of thine hands <WH3027>.
For now thou numberest <WH5608> my steps <WH6806>: dost thou not watch <WH8104> over my sin <WH2403>?
My transgression <WH6588> is sealed up <WH2856> in a bag <WH6872>, and thou sewest up <WH2950> mine iniquity <WH5771>.
And surely <WH199> the mountain <WH2022> falling <WH5307> cometh to nought <WH5034>, and the rock <WH6697> is removed <WH6275> out of his place <WH4725>. cometh: Heb. fadeth

The waters <WH4325> wear <WH7833> the stones <WH68>: thou washest away <WH7857> the things which grow <WH5599> out of the dust <WH6083> of the earth <WH776>; and thou destroyest <WH6> the hope <WH8615> of man <WH582>. washest: Heb. overflowest
Thou prevailest <WH8630> for ever <WH5331> against him, and he passeth <WH1980>: thou changest <WH8138> his countenance <WH6440>, and sendest him away <WH7971>.
His sons <WH1121> come to honour <WH3513>, and he knoweth <WH3045> it not; and they are brought low <WH6819>, but he perceiveth <WH995> it not of them.
But his flesh <WH1320> upon him shall have pain <WH3510>, and his soul <WH5315> within him shall mourn <WH56>.
